flixel.plugin.MouseEventManager

type
class
extends
FlxPlugin
Provides mouse event detection for FlxSprites. To use it, initialize the manager and register sprites. FlxG.plugins.add(new MouseInteractionMgr()); var spr:FlxSprite = new FlxSprite(); MouseEventManager.addSprite(spr, onMouseDown, onMouseUp, onMouseOver, onMouseOut); Or simply add a new sprite the manager will initialize itself: MouseEventManager.addSprite(spr, onMouseDown, onMouseUp, onMouseOver, onMouseOut); Also implement the callbacks with FlxSprite return: function onMouseDown(sprite:FlxSprite) {} function onMouseUp(sprite:FlxSprite) {} function onMouseOver(sprite:FlxSprite) {} function onMouseOut(sprite:FlxSprite) {}

Static Methods

addSprite(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, ?OnMouseDown : flixel.FlxSprite -> Void, ?OnMouseUp : flixel.FlxSprite -> Void, ?OnMouseOver : flixel.FlxSprite -> Void, ?OnMouseOut : flixel.FlxSprite -> Void, ?MouseChildren : Bool, ?MouseEnabled : Bool) : Void

parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite
OnMouseDown Callback when mouse is pressed down over this sprite. Must have Sprite as argument - e.g. onMouseDown(sprite:FlxSprite).
OnMouseUp Callback when mouse is released over this sprite. Must have Sprite as argument - e.g. onMouseDown(sprite:FlxSprite).
OnMouseOver Callback when mouse is this sprite. Must have Sprite as argument - e.g. onMouseDown(sprite:FlxSprite).
OnMouseOut Callback when mouse moves out of this sprite. Must have Sprite as argument - e.g. onMouseDown(sprite:FlxSprite).
MouseChildren If mouseChildren is enabled, other sprites overlaped by this will still receive mouse events.
MouseEnabled If mouseEnabled this sprite will receive mouse events.
Adds a sprite to MouseInteractionMgr registry. Even without any initialization, this is all that is needed to add mouse behaviour to FlxSprites.

inline init() : Void

As alternative you can call MouseEventManager.init().

isSpriteMouseChildren(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite) : Bool

parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite.
Checks if an FlxSprite allows mouseChildren.

isSpriteMouseEnabled(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite) : Bool

parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite.
Checks if an FlxSprite is mouseEnabled.

removeSprite(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite) : Void

parameters
Sprite
Removes a sprite from the registry.

reorderSprites() : Void

Reorders the registered sprites, using the current sprite drawing order. This should be called if you alter the draw/update order of a registered sprite, That is, if you alter the position of a registered sprite inside its FlxGroup. It may also be called if the sprites are not registered by the same order they are added to FlxGroup.

setMouseDownCallback(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, OnMouseDown : flixel.FlxSprite -> Void) : Void

parameters
Sprite The sprite to set the callback.
OnMouseDown Callback when mouse is pressed down over this sprite. Must have Sprite as argument - e.g. onMouseDown(sprite:FlxSprite).
Sets the mouseDown callback associated with a sprite.

setMouseOutCallback(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, OnMouseOut : flixel.FlxSprite -> Void) : Void

parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite to set the callback.
OnMouseOver Callback when mouse is moves out of this sprite. Must have Sprite as argument - e.g. onMouseDown(sprite:FlxSprite).
Sets the mouseOut callback associated with a sprite.

setMouseOverCallback(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, OnMouseOver : flixel.FlxSprite -> Void) : Void

parameters
Sprite The sprite to set the callback.
OnMouseOver Callback when mouse is over this sprite. Must have Sprite as argument - e.g. onMouseDown(sprite:FlxSprite).
Sets the mouseOver callback associated with a sprite.

setMouseUpCallback(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, OnMouseUp : flixel.FlxSprite -> Void) : Void

parameters
Sprite The sprite to set the callback.
OnMouseUp Callback when mouse is released over this sprite. Must have Sprite as argument - e.g. onMouseDown(sprite:FlxSprite).
Sets the mouseUp callback associated with a sprite.

setSpriteMouseChildren(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, MouseChildren : Bool) : Void

parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite.
MouseChildren Whether this sprite will allow other overlapped sprites to receive mouseEvents.
Enables/disables mouseChildren for an FlxSprite.

setSpriteMouseEnabled(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, MouseEnabled : Bool) : Void

parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite.
MouseEnabled Whether this sprite will be tested for mouse events.
Enables/disables mouse behavior for an FlxSprite.

Constructor

new()
Call this using FlxG.plugins.add(new MouseEventMgr()).

ID : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
IDs seem like they could be pretty useful, huh? They're not actually used for anything yet though.

active(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether update() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

alive(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Useful state for many game objects - "dead" (!alive) vs alive. kill() and revive() both flip this switch (along with exists, but you can override that).

cameras : Array<FlxCamera>

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
An array of camera objects that this object will use during draw(). This value will initialize itself during the first draw to automatically point at the main camera list out in FlxG unless you already set it. You can also change it afterward too, very flexible!

collisionType : flixel.system.FlxCollisionType

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic

exists(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
This flag indicates whether this objects has been destroyed or not. Cannot be set, use destroy() and revive().

ignoreDrawDebug : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Setting this to true will prevent the object from appearing when the visual debug mode in the debugger overlay is toggled on.

visible(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether draw() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

destroy() : Void

overrides flixel.FlxBasic

draw() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Override this function to control how the object is drawn. Overriding draw() is rarely necessary, but can be very useful.

drawDebug() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic

drawDebugOnCamera(?Camera : FlxCamera) : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
parameters
Camera Which camera to draw the debug visuals to.
Override this function to draw custom "debug mode" graphics to the specified camera while the debugger's visual mode is toggled on.

kill() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for "killing" game objects. Use reset() to revive them. Default behavior is to flag them as nonexistent AND dead. However, if you want the "corpse" to remain in the game, like to animate an effect or whatever, you should override this, setting only alive to false, and leaving exists true.

onResize(Width : Int, Height : Int) : Void

inherited from flixel.plugin.FlxPlugin
parameters
Width The new window width
Height The new window Height
This function is called whenever the window size has been changed.

onStateSwitch() : Void

inherited from flixel.plugin.FlxPlugin
This function is called whenever the state is switched or reset (FlxG.switchState() and FlxG.resetState()).

revive() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for bringing game objects "back to life". Just sets alive and exists back to true. In practice, this function is most often called by FlxObject.reset().

toString() : String

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Convert object to readable string name. Useful for debugging, save games, etc.

update() : Void

overrides flixel.FlxBasic
